source.name: Your turn : magazine layout
source.instructions:
Now we want to have a nice magazine-like layout, one float on the left, one float on the right ...

Play with the balloons, changing their `float` and `clear` properties, until you reach this:

![](.guides/img/magazine.png)

source.name: Correct the paragraph example
source.instructions: In the file `dont-abuse-p.html` in the top left hand pane, change the `div` and `span` elements making a fake paragraph and a fake bold by the correct tags, as shown in the previous section.

source.name: Your turn : float them all left
source.instructions:
For this first little challenge, we ask you to float all the balloons to the left.
For that, in the control area, at the bottom of the balloon playground, click on "left" for all the balloons. When it's done, click "Check it".

source.name: Create your first div
source.instructions:
In the file `concrete-example.html` in the top left hand pane:
- Add a second `div` after `user-panel`. 
- Add a class `my-div` to it.
- Write the text "This is my first div!" inside it.
- Refresh the page!

Good luck!

source.name: a none challenge
source.instructions:
You can have a look at the `none-challenge.html` file in the top left hand pane and at its preview underneath.
The preview should be all black with just the title "A none challenge". That's normal because we have put all the elements after the title with the property `display:none;`.

The goal of this challenge is to make them visible again ! You have to change the display mode of the classes `.title`, `.author`, `.book`, `.paragraph`, `highlight`  to either `display:inline;` or `display:block;`, so that the layout looks is visible again! 

As a hint, here is a screenshot of how it should look :

![](.guides/img/none-challenge.png)

Good luck !

source.name: fixing inline block whitespaces
source.instructions: Go ahead and remove all the whitespaces between the `` that's the end of an element and the `` that's the beginning of the next one. Then you can refresh the preview window and have the expected result! Good luck!

source.name: Fix the layout
source.instructions:
In order to fix our layout, we ask you to modify the file `3columns.html`in the top left hand pane. 

Add a `margin-left` of 2% to the blue `div` and the orange `div`.

Good luck!

source.name: Fix the layout
source.instructions:
We have to add something to the footer so that it goes at the bottom.
Go ahead and add one property to the `#footer` styling in file `fixit.html` in the top left hand pane.
If you don't find the solution, you might want to consider revisiting section 9 of this unit.

Good luck!

source.name: Your turn : some on the left, some on the right
source.instructions:
Now, please: 
- Make the balloons 1, 2 and 3 float on the left.
- Make the balloons 4 and 5 float on the right.

source.name: Your turn : all floating right
source.instructions: Now make all the balloons float to the right, please.

source.name: Change to display block
source.instructions:
In the file `inlineall.html` in the top left hand pane, we have gathered a few of the previous examples.

You are asked to :
- Change the display mode of the `div` selector to `block` instead of `inline`.
- Observe how it changes the behaviour in the preview at the bottom.

source.name: Float it right
source.instructions:
Go in the file `float-in-text.html` in the top left hand pane and change the CSS of the `div` selector so that it will float to the right, instead of left.

Refresh the bottom pane to see the result.
Good luck!

source.name: Correct the list example
source.instructions: In the file `dont-abuse-list.html` in the top left hand pane, you are asked to replace the `div` and `span` elements that are making a "fake" list by the correct version using `ul` and `li` as shown in the previous section.

source.name: Your turn : C for Codio
source.instructions:
Again, play with the `float` and `clear` properties of the balloons until you reach this:
![](.guides/img/c-for-codio.png)

Good luck!

source.name: Your turn : do a balloon column
source.instructions:
You have to play with the `float` property and `clear` property of all the balloons until you reach this:
![](.guides/img/left-column.png)

Good luck!

source.name: Your turn : all but one
source.instructions:
This time you are simply asked to "unfloat" the first balloon. 
In the controls on the left, make sure the first balloon is neither floating right nor left.

source.name: Fix the collapsed container
source.instructions:
We just have to add a `div` that would have the `clear` property after our floats.  In the file `clear.html` in the top left hand pane:
- Add a `div` with a class `clearfix`  after the last `div` with class `floating`, inside the `div` with class `container`.
- Go up in the `<style>` section and create a class called `clearfix` with the only property : `clear:both;`
- Refresh the preview window at the bottom to see if the gray container is now as in the picture below:
![](.guides/img/clearfix-solution.png)
Good luck!
